Posts.Content: Meria54 wrote: Has anybody reach the point where they are just tired? I been diagnosed with different stages of breast cancer and been though all the treatments and I'm just done. I just want a break from anything medical. For the past six years, I been in treatment, hospital and followup....I'm so done with it all. I believe I have the best doctors and nurses working with me....I'm just so tired all it all and ready to give up. When is enough is enough? I have 3 beautiful kids and 5 beautiful grandkids....my world! Just so tired of it all.... I know that all breast cancer is bad but being diagnose with Stage 4 Metastatic is so hard (2014)... Ladies I really need your best advice... Dx 4/7/2010, IDC, 2cm, Stage IIB, Grade 3, 5/15 nodes, mets, ER+, HER2- Surgery 5/25/2010 Lumpectomy: Left Chemotherapy 8/7/2010 Taxol (paclitaxel), Taxotere (docetaxel) Radiation Therapy 10/24/2010 Breast Dx 10/26/2012, DCIS, 2cm, Stage IIIA, Grade 1, 0/0 nodes, mets, ER+ Surgery 12/9/2012 Mastectomy: Left Dx 6/6/2014, IDC, 5cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 3/10 nodes, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2- Chemotherapy 7/7/2014 Taxotere (docetaxel) Surgery 12/18/2014 Lumpectomy: Right; Reconstruction (right): DIEP flap Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: so Tired Meria54 Maureen813

Posts.Content: Jan 7, 2015 01:06PM Meria54 wrote: Hello everyone, I finished my last chemotherapy on on Oct 22, 2014. Continue to have issues with the tingling and numbness of both my hands and feets, along with that my fingernails have turn brown with white lines and have loss a couple of fingernails the same with my toenails. Did anyone else have this problem and can anyone tell me how long it will be before my nails return to "normal" ? Thanks
Posts.Title: Feet and hand numbness? shaM Moderators
